snippet: The announcement of the truce came just hours after two bombings killed 13 people and wounded 10 in an attack on a polio vaccination team in the northwestern Khyber region.
abstract: Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan, umbrella organization of Pakistan's militants, declares monthlong ceasefire in hopes that government will revive peace talks; government agrees to release all noncombatant detainees and says talks can resume within a week.

byline.contributor: Ismail Khan contributed reporting from Peshawar, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The announcement of the truce came just hours after two bombings killed 13 people and wounded 10 in an attack on a polio vaccination team in the northwestern Khyber region.

headline.main: Pakistani Taliban, Announcing Cease-Fire, Urge the Revival of Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Taliban, Announcing Cease-Fire, Urge the Revival of Peace Talks
